roleset.name: include
roleset.note: INCLUDE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'include' based on big corpus; adjectival 'inclusive' based on BOLT-4,5. (from include.01-v)
INCLUSIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from inclusive.01-j)

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: include-v: group as PP
example.text: John includes Mary in the list of people he admires.
example.arg: in the list of people he admires

example.name: include-v: group as subject
example.text: The project did not include Seymour Cray.

example.name: include-v: no group mentioned
example.text: The government includes money spent on residential renovation.

example.name: include-v: passive, with group as PP
example.text: [Losses from the earthquake in California]-1 would be included *trace*-1 in 4th QTR results.

example.name: include-v: PP-group in subject position
example.text: ...included *trace*-1 on the list are [John and Mary]-1

example.name: inclusive-j
example.text: Maybe they-1 wanted *PRO*-1 to be inclusive because they want to sell you a car and your race does n't matter one way or the other .
example.arg: because they want to sell you a car and your race doesn't matter one way or the other

example.name: inclusion-n: Arg0,1,2
example.text: Many attribute China's rise to their inclusion of capitalism into their society.

roleset.name: subset

role.descr: relative size of subset compared to superset

example.name: percentage
example.text: 10% of smokers die of lung cancer.
example.arg: people who die of lung cancer

example.name: 190 of 200
example.text: 190 of 200 British newspapers owned by Murdoch.

example.name: including
example.text: The company employs several translators, including five from China.

roleset.note: Added to support AMR annotations, based on group discussion on May 23, 2012, by Ulf at ISI.
